venice.lib.networkRSB

Class ClassMatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • venice.lib.networkRSB.ClassMatcher

  • public class ClassMatcher
extends java.lang.Object
    Collects reflection classes and methods for matching data holding classes between different protocols. If a builder is present, it also holds an instance of that builder class, ready to use for creating instances of the target class.

    All needed information have to be given on construction and can't be changed afterwards. As this are final fields, they are directly accessed (no methods to set or get fields.)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.reflect.Method build
      The method of the builder to build an object of the target class with the set values.
      java.lang.Object builderInstance
      The builder object that builds an instance of the target class.
      java.lang.reflect.Constructor<?> constructor
      The constructor of the target class.
      java.lang.reflect.Method[] getter
      An array of methods that are used to get a value from an object of the source class.
      boolean isRepeated
      An indicator, if this is a multifield class.
      java.lang.reflect.Method resetter
      The method of the builder to reset all values.
      java.lang.reflect.Method[] setter
      The method of the builder to set a value.
      java.lang.Class<?> source
      The source class, that get matched to the target class.
      java.lang.Class<?> target
      The target class, to which the source class gets matched.
      java.lang.Class<?>[] type
      The types of the values that are getting matched between both classes.
      boolean useConstructor
      An indicator, if an instance of the target class is build with a constructor or with a builder.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClassMatcher

        public ClassMatcher(java.lang.Class<?> source,
            java.lang.Class<?> target,
            java.lang.reflect.Method[] getter,
            java.lang.reflect.Constructor<?> constructor,
            java.lang.Class<?>[] type,
            boolean isRepeated)
        Constructs the settings for a matching situation with a constructor for the target.
        It is assumed that the first getter-method provides the value for the first constructor parameter, the second getter for the second constructor parameter, and so on.
        Parameters:
        source - Class to match
        target - Class to match to
        getter - getter-methods for the source class
        constructor - the constructor for the matching target class
        type - the types for each pair of a getter and a constructor parameter
        isRepeated - false for singlefields, true for multifields

      • ClassMatcher

        public ClassMatcher(java.lang.Class<?> source,
            java.lang.Class<?> target,
            java.lang.Object builderInstance,
            java.lang.reflect.Method resetter,
            java.lang.reflect.Method[] getter,
            java.lang.reflect.Method[] setter,
            java.lang.reflect.Method build,
            java.lang.Class<?>[] type,
            boolean isRepeated)
        Constructs the settings for a matching situation with a builder for the target.
        The builder is used to build an instance of the target class. The setter-methods are invoked on the builder. It is assumed that the first getter-method provides the value for the first setter-method (or the first parameter of the constructor), the second getter for the second setter (or second constructor parameter), and so on.
        Parameters:
        source - Class to match
        target - Class to match to
        builderInstance - An instantiated builder that builds instances of the target class
        resetter - method of builder class to reset values
        getter - getter-methods of the source class
        setter - setter-methods of the builder class
        type - the types for each pair of a getter and a setter method
        isRepeated - false for singlefields, true for multifields

    • Method Detail

      • resetBuilder

        public void resetBuilder()
        Resets the values of the builder instance. This is important for multifields, because values are usually added and not set. If no reset is done, the next data object would contain additionally the values of the last data object.
        For singlefields it is usually not neccessary to reset the values, because they get overwritten.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Gives a human comprehensible string representation of this ClassMatcher instance.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String string representation of this instance
